Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Simsboro -- 1.25% S&U - Mayor & BOA - Perp.
Race.SummaryText:
Village of Simsboro Proposition
(1.25% Sales Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Simsboro, Louisiana (the "Village"), under Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one and one-fourth percent (1.25%) (the "Tax"), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Village, for a perpetual term commencing January 1, 2017, collections from the Tax for the first year expected to be approximately $2,400, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying costs of collection and administration), to be dedicated and used for any lawful corporate purpose of the Village, and for authority to fund a portion of the avails of the Tax into Bonds in the manner provided by law?
